titleStmt.title: Periya Purāṇam, preceded by the Tiruttoṇṭattokai.

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Periya Purāṇam (U2b, f2v1-f286; 4281 stanzas), directly preceded, on the same page (f2v1) by the Tiruttoṇṭattokai (Tēvāram 7.39) (U2a, f1-f2v1; 11 stanzas). The two texts follow one another directly on the same page: the Tiruttoṇṭattokai ends on f2v1 and the the Periya Purāṇam starts immediately after, on the same line.
This is possibly an Ariel manuscript, borrowed by Vinson and later returned by Vinson.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation, despite boreholes. Several folios truncated.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Verso blank.
279 folios. Tamil foliation 1-286 with foliation gaps/missing folios. 274 folios in order, with gaps, followed by 5 folios, with foliation lost, which must fill some of the gaps.
2 folios = Tiruttoṇṭattokai. Tamil foliation 1-2. From f1r1 to f2v1.
278 folios = Periya Purāṇam. Tamil foliation 1-286 with foliation gaps/missing folios. From f2v1 to f286v2.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Not after 1855, if was part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

acquisition.p: Returned by / Received from Julien Vinson. See manuscript addition, f2v, no. 943 to Cabaton (1912).

provenance.p: Probably owned by Edouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Edouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177). The title page is typical of Ariel's manuscripts.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See manuscript addition, f2v, no. 943.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
